intro: Acrostichum curvans, commonly known as the curved fern, is a species of fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, curved fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a unique, curling appearance. Acrostichum curvans plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
